RESOLVED_ENTITIES.United States Court of Appeals for the F: United States Court of Appeals for the Fifth Circuit
RESOLVED_ENTITIES.the Court: United States Court of Appeals for the Fifth Circuit

AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States: country where the case is being tried
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States District Court: court that convicted Maria De Jesus Garcia, involved in the appeal of her case, made oral findings of fact regarding the constitutionality of the stop and search, and has discretion to give the Allen charge
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States Government: government whose agents conducted the stop and search, defendant in the appeal
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States Border Patrol: law enforcement agency involved in the stop and search of a pickup truck camper, conducted immigration inspections and roving patrols near the United States-Mexican border, had agents who apprehended illegal alien smugglers and were entitled to question occupants about their citizenship and immigration status after stopping a vehicle
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States Court of Appeals for the F: a court that articulated principles for investigatory stops, relied upon an agent's observation, is handling the appeal of Maria De Jesus Garcia's case, has made a ruling on probable cause, and has upheld the use of the modified Allen charge in jury instructions
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States-Mexico Border: geographic location related to the case, relevant for determining the origin of vehicles and individuals
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Brignoni-Ponce Standard: legal standard or precedent used to determine reasonable suspicion in immigration inspections and stops
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States District Court Jury: jury that was given the Allen charge after indicating deadlock
